articles.author: FERNANDO DEL VALLE, Staff Writer
articles.title: Port Isabel church to bless Oblate memorial
articles.description: PORT ISABEL — In 1849, the Oblates Fathers of Mary Immaculate climbed off a boat to begin their long service to this seaside community.

articles.author: By Nadia Tamez-Robledo Staff writer
articles.title: Suspects to be arraigned in Port Isabel election night fight
articles.description: Cameron County Sheriff Omar Lucio said suspects in a Port Isabel election night fight outside City Hall are expected to be arraigned Wednesday afternoon. The Port Isabel Police Department asked his office to take over the investigation May 7, he said.

articles.author: By Diana Eva Maldonado, Staff writer
articles.title: Police: Motorcyclist strikes, kills woman in Port Isabel
articles.description: Port Isabel Police say a woman was killed Sunday night when she was struck by a motorcyclist who was speeding on the emergency lane of the city’s main road.

articles.author: By Diana Eva Maldonado, Staff writer
articles.title: Couple charged with child abuse, giving 5-month-old inhalant
articles.description: Port Isabel Police arrested a couple they say sexually abused a baby and gave the infant an air inhalant.

articles.author: By Diana Eva Maldonado, Staff writer
articles.title: Police: Suspects stole $7100 in electronics from Walmart stores
articles.description: Port Isabel Police are searching for two suspects accused of stealing thousands of dollars in electronics from two area Walmart stores.

articles.author: By MARK REAGAN | Staff Writer
articles.title: Lawsuit alleges housing discrimination in P.I.
articles.description: A lawsuit filed in federal court late Monday afternoon alleges that city leaders in Port Isabel discriminated against low-income Hispanic residents in the years following Hurricane Dolly.

articles.title: Former Port Isabel HS teacher accused of improper relationship with a student
articles.description: The Precinct 1 Constable’s Office has arrested and charged a former Port Isabel High School coach and math teacher with having a sexual relationship with a student.

articles.author: By NADIA TAMEZ-ROBLEDO | Staff Writer
articles.title: Early voting spots to change
articles.description: Early voters in Port Isabel, Los Fresnos and Brownsville will head to new polling places for the March 6 primary. Cameron County commissioners approved the changes during last week’s meeting.

articles.title: Runners traverse causeway during fitness run, walk
articles.description: After a run that started at Schlitterbahn and continued across the Queen Isabella Memorial Bridge, Norman Esquivel said he crossed the finish line in Port Isabel with a smile.

articles.title: Protests continue as Trump administration moves to reunite separated families - Chron.com
articles.description:
Kristen Ruiz has never thought of herself as an activist. But one night last week, as the stay-at-home mother of three  rocked her 17-month-old  to sleep, she was overcome with sadness and anger at the thought of the government taking her children from her.
